subject: Relationships
title: Bids for Connection
description: A fast breakdown of Bids for Connection for builders.

hook.text: 'Look at that bird!' seems trivial. But how you respond to that sentence predicts your relationship's future.

buildup.text: Gottman calls small moments of reaching out 'bids for connection.' They happen dozens of times daily.

discovery.text: Happy couples respond to 86% of bids. Unhappy couples respond to only 33%. The gap is enormous.

twist.text: Most bids aren't dramatic. 'How was your day?' is a bid. Ignoring it is a tiny rejection that compounds.

climax.text: Relationships don't die from one big betrayal. They starve from hundreds of ignored small moments.
